Decaf Editor API

Package com.bitwise.decaf.editor

This package contains the foundation of the Decaf editor, including all user interface components for code constructs up to but excluding the contents of method bodies (those are found in the grammar package).

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Decaf An empty interface that extends Serializable and distinguishes classes intended for .cup file storage from other serializable classes that will make a mess if they are put on disk (e.g., all javax.swing classes are Serializable, but who needs that in a data file?).
DecafTextComponent A further specification of MaskComponent for declaration fields that must provide the user with a plain text input mechanism.
DecafTypeComponent A further specification of MaskComponent for declaration fields that must provide the user with a Type-compatible input mechanism.
MaskComponent A MaskComponent is designed for use in one of the declaration masks: ClassMask, MethodMask and VariableMask.
Type A Decaf UI representation of a class.
Type.Field A Variable that is designated by convention to be a class field, and therefore is Configurable with documentation.
Typed Implemented by any Decaf construct that bears a Type.
Utils.List.Listener Radio frequency for List.
Utils.Renderable Implemented by visible components.
 

Class Summary
DTextField A generic text field that implements the requisite interfaces for participation in the Decaf masks.
DTypeBox A generic type box (consisting of a {@link javax.swing.JPanel)) that implements the requisite interfaces for participation in the Decaf masks.
Form A form specialized to take contraints information from the configuration file.
Mask A specialization of Form that extracts a list of components from a configuration file entry and places them into the superclass.
Type.Cache Internal: Cache of all Types in the system.
Type.CacheKey Internal: key class for the TypeCache, comprised of the type's classname and its array dimensions.
Type.FieldsByName Internal: a map of fieldName:field, where field is a Variable.
Type.MethodsByName Internal: a map of methodName::Collection, in which the collection contains all the methods with the given name (each with a unique signature).
Type.NoType A Type that represents a user interface state in which the user has neglected to set a type on a particular field, or has removed a type without replacing it.
Type.NullType A Type to represents the Java keyword null.
Type.VoidType A Type to represents the Java keyword void.
Utils This static class provides facilities for a number of common Decaf operations that are distinct from an instance of any particular thing, or that cannot be attached to the appropriate source (Type methods, for instance, cannot be included in the interface Type, by language rule).
Utils.CollectionMap CollectionMap stores key-collection pairs, and allows a single value to be added to a collection by key reference.
Utils.EmptyVector The EmptyVector rejects all attempts to add elements to it, such that a single instance of it may be used universally as a "no thanks" reponse from implementations of abstract and interface methods requiring a return value of collection.
Utils.List List maintains an ordered set (rejecting duplicate additions on the basis of equals()), and notifies Utils.List.Listeners when its contents change.
Utils.List.Event This Event is passed to Listeners of List when its contents change.
Utils.ListModel A ListModel based on a List, which may be applied to the model at any time.
Utils.Location A diagonally incrementable Dimension.
Utils.RealEstateManager Facilitates the placement of windows on the desktop.
Utils.RenderLabel A JLabel customized for use in a RenderPanel; defaults to opaque with white background.
Utils.RenderPanel Adds some convenience to JPanel, and sets all contained components to be transparent, such that the background color of the RenderPanel always shows through.
Utils.SerialVector A Vector that attempts to weed out non-serializable components before going to disk.
 

Exception Summary
Utils.SerialException Reports an attempt to serialize an instance of a class that has been determined to be non-serializable (by policy or by definition)
 

Package com.bitwise.decaf.editor Description

This package contains the foundation of the Decaf editor, including all user interface components for code constructs up to but excluding the contents of method bodies (those are found in the grammar package). All components and their presentation to the user are configurable through modification of the configuration file config.xml (see config.dtd in the com.bitwise.decaf.editor.config directory), and the attachment of custom components to editor dialogs. This package contains some facilities that are used by the grammar package, and it is only those classes that are being documented here.
